newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Burlington one of buyers of Russian confectioner. [CORRECTED 19:30 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Burlington one of buyers of Russian confectioner. [CORRECTED 19:30 GMT]

text.p: Burlington Investments was one of several buyers of a 45 percent stake in Russia's sixth biggest confectioner OAO Konditerskaya Fabrika Volzhanka, the head of Volzhanka said on Wednesday.
Chief Executive Anatoly Revenkov told a news conference Burlington had bought an unspecified part of 5.71 million shares in a public share offering completed on September 27.
He did not mention the other buyers, but Volzhanka's financial adviser Creditanstalt-Grant said that big Western investment funds participated in the offering.
Burlington Investments is owned by ING-Baring.
The factory will use the $5.5 million raised from the issue to buy new equipment which will increase the company's daily production by 50 percent from its current 10 tonnes, Revenkov said.
Volzhanka, located in Ulyanovsk on the Volga river, had a 1996 first half year net profit of 24.76 billion roubles ($4,530), according to Russian accounting standards.
In the first half of 1995 the net profit was 11.26 billion roubles.
(Corrects Volzhanka profit figures to billions from millions)
Volzhanka's major shareholders are the employees with 40 percent of shares and the government with 11 percent of shares.
-- Julie Tolkacheva, Moscow Newsroom, +7095 941 8520 ($ = 5456 Russian Roubles)
